fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Education and training, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
– The Proposal for a DIRECTIVE OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on certain aspects concerning contracts for the supply of digital content (2015/0287 (COD)) 
– The Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on addressing geo-blocking and other forms of discrimination based on customers' nationality, place of residence or place of establishment within the internal market and amending Regulation (EC) No 2006/2004 and Directive 2009/22/EC (2016/0152 (COD)) 
– The Proposal for a DIRECTIVE OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on copyright in the Digital Single Market (2016/0280 (COD)) 
– The Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on ensuring the cross-border portability of online content services in the internal market (2015/0284 (COD)) 
– The Proposal for a DIRECTIVE OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL amending Directive 2010/13/EU on the coordination of certain provisions laid down by law, regulation or administrative action in Member States concerning the provision of audiovisual media services in view of changing market realities (2016/0151 (COD)) 
– Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL laying down rules on the exercise of copyright and related rights applicable to certain online transmissions of broadcasting organisations and retransmissions of television and radio programmes ((2016/0284 (COD)) 
– Review of Council Directive 93/83/EEC of 27 September 1993 on the coordination of certain rules concerning copyright and rights related to copyright applicable to satellite broadcasting and cable retransmission 
– THE TRANSATLANTIC TRADE AND INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIP
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Sweeney Consulting has two primary clients for which legal and public policy activities are conducted in Brussels: 
 
– The Interactive Software Federation of Europe (ISFE), the trade association for Europe's Video Games Industry; and 
– The Association of International Collective Management of Audiovisual Works (AGICOA), a pan-European Collecting Society that administers cable retransmission and other rights on behalf of independent producers.
goals__remit:
Sweeney Consulting is a law and public affairs consultancy based in Dublin Ireland that also operates in London, Brussels and Geneva as well as other countries in Europe as needed. 
 
SWEENEY CONSULTING offers the following services to companies, associations and individuals: 
 
• Advice on how European and National Law And  
  Regulation affects industry today 
• Expert insight on Media and Entertainment 
• Licensing and Protection of Intellectual Property Rights  
• Wide ranging and detailed expertise on today’s    
  international Video Game industry
